header.title: The Contract
header.notice: The legal tone of this document is just a gimmick, this is not a legal document in any sense. At all times: since this is open source: the real contract is described in the implementation details of the full distribution. This tries to list (not explain) what the ins and outs of using forrest is about. Please let us know if any of the bullets listed here are out of sync with the real implementation.
header.abstract: This document describes in a very techy bullet-style way how to use Forrest.

body.p: This document describes the formal contract between the Forrest distribution code, hereafter referred as Forrest, and the Project (team) using it for generating its documentation web-site, hereafter TheProject, or in the best case: You.

ul.li: provide DTDs, skins, cocoon-pipelines, and a willing team of supporting developers at forrest-dev@apache.org
use Cocoon to generate the HTML documentation for TheProject

section.title: TheProject Must:
section.note: {docroot} is the location inside TheProject's file hierarchy where all documentation related resources are stored. Commonly, {docroot} equals to {projecthome}/src/documentation

ul.li: provide XML content in {docroot}/content/xdocs using the forrest DTDs,
provide content navigation metadata by sliding book.xml and tabs.xml files in there as well. (Forrest is working on a libre alternative to the book.xml approach).
provide own xml project descriptor files in the directory {projecthome}

section.title: TheProject Can (accidentally):
section.warning: Use the following features at your own risk. These are only side-effects of the current implementation. Perhaps this shouldn't be documented at all.

ul.li: provide his own skin in a directory {docroot}/skins/{your-skin-name} (check the current Forrest skins and the related pipelines to see what they are doing)

provide own DTDs (and stylesheets) to work with in {docroot}/resources/schema/dtd
maybe also extra required stylesheets to convert own grammar to 'document' (being the format that the skins work on)
and probably with an updated {docroot}/resources/schema/catalog

provide his own overwriting versions of {docroot}/sitemap.xmap, {docroot}/cocoon.xconf etc ... (be sure you know what you are doing since you're leaving the area where other Forresters can help you out.
provide own Java classes or libraries needed in the generation process,
